alert.note: Alert for Taylor (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 10 at 9:26PM CST until February 11 at 4:00AM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Periods of Snow/Wintry Mix With Slick Travel... Snow continues to fall. Pockets of blowing and drifting snow is leading to poor visibilities and drifts up to 8 inches deep on roadways. Warmer temperatures are approaching from the west and could lead to periods of rain or a wintry mix. Drifting should subside with the arrival of warmer temperatures. In the wake of the storm, patchy freezing drizzle could linger into the early morning hours. If traveling tonight, be prepared for wintry driving conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Taylor County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, check 511ia.org in Iowa, 511mn.org in Minnesota, and 511wi.gov in Wisconsin.
